intro: Solms-laubachia minor, commonly known as the dwarf solms-laubachia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some aquatic species. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered near the base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in humid lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
